custom_fields.goals: Varies by semester. Spring 2024Acquire an overview of South Asian cinemas with an emphasis on their history, implications, industrial structure.Develop an understanding of South Asian Cinemas that goes beyond popular cinema. Assess nonEurocentric modes of analyzing popular and arthouse cinemas produced and circulated outside the west.Analyze the cultural, political, and economic forces that have shaped various South Asian film movements from the 1950s to the present.Discuss films in their historical context and as part of a filmmakers oeuvre. Describe and interrogate the concepts of regional cinema, national cinema, and world cinema.
custom_fields.key_topics: Varies by semester. Spring 2024: Bollywood, song and dance sequence, aesthetics,diaspora
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Varies by semester. Spring 2024: Essays/research paper; presentation
custom_fields.relevance: Varies by semester. Spring 2024: This course will enable students to build a cinematic and cultural vocabulary to engage with popular culture, particularly cinema, from non-Western contexts. The course will familiarize students with some of the significant debates and issues in South Asian cinemas, such as the role of cinema in the postcolonial state, cinema and national identity, caste, gender, and cinematic representation, debates on realism and melodrama, the significance of the song and dance numbers, and the nature of film censorship.
